channel.title: Client Crashing?
channel.description:
I GOT THE RIGHT SECTION! ...
K, well.. i just got this new computer. And so far, i play one 508. And own a 508, 317, and 474.
When i play on my own 508, i'm fine. When i play my friends 508, i'm fine.
When i play my 474, and 317, i can walk somewhere 1 time. If i click somewhere again, my client crashes, and says this: http://yfrog.com/5mcrashmp
Why does this only happen to my 317 and my 474? Not my 508? Or my friends 508?
If you don't understand, tell me, i will upload a video.

item.title: Client Crashing?
item.dc:creator: @Preist Preist
item.description:
@Preist wrote:

Now you all COMPLETELY messed up my brain. -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crashing?
item.dc:creator: @Preist Preist
item.description:
@Preist wrote:

[quote=“faze1one, post:11, topic:353910”][quote author=Preist link=topic=450207.msg3303227#msg3303227 date=1281465238]

Did it, now when i try to run my 317, i get dis:

http://yfrog.com/0vproblemeap

now download the new jdk, set the path, and it should work

What path? O_O…

Again, i may sound like a dumb ass, but link plawkz?
[/quote]

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin;

add that to your environment variables[/quote]

You have me totally fricken confused… Where is Environment Variables? If it’s that User Variables then What do i put as the Name? And what do i put as the value?

IDK… you both fucked up my brain. :c

Read full topic

[/quote]

What path? O_O…

Again, i may sound like a dumb ass, but link plawkz? :)[/quote]

add that to your environment variables

[quote=“Shilo Village, post:9, topic:353910”]Why the f**k are you using the server VM to run a RSPS client?

Solution: In Eclipse or batch file remove -server[/quote]

Sorry, but i don’t understand your solution at ALL.

item.title: Client Crashing?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

[quote=“Preist, post:4, topic:353910”]I may sound like a dumb ass. But i don’t know how to uninstall Java.

And, i can’t find the 32bit download on oracle.com.[/quote]

You need to go to your start menu…if you are using vista, you need to go to control panel -> Programs. There you should be able to pick an option to uninstall programs…Just locate Java. After Uninstalling that go to this website:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk6-jsp-136632.html

Click download -> you should come to a screen where it asks for a Platform with a drop-down Menu. Select the arrow and you will get a list of operating systems. you want to choose “windows” this will select 32bit. Continue with the download.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crashing?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

I had the same problem, It’s rather simple to fix. I’m assuming you have a windows 7 64 bit. If not? well I can’t help you than. All you need to do is uninstall your JDK, and Install the 32bit version. That should work.

Read full topic
